title: gemm: microkernel k-loop unroll
description: Implement and benchmark k-loop unrolling in src/gemm.zig microKernel/microKernelPartial (AVX2 baseline: f32 unroll=4, f64 unroll=2 initially). Measure impact under tools/bench_oracles.sh --p-only; keep correctness gates passing.
close_reason: Tried k-loop unroll in src/gemm.zig microKernel/microKernelPartial (f32 unroll=4, f64 unroll=2) with pointer increments. It regressed badly under --p-only: ops.gemm(f32) ~108 -> ~73 GFLOP/s; parallel.gemm(8) ~760 -> ~503 GFLOP/s. Reverted. Likely worse codegen / spills / frontend pressure for the current MR=8 NR=8 B-broadcast kernel shape. Next: consider a BLIS-like N-vectorized kernel shape (e.g. MR=6 NR=16) or explicit accumulator scalarization/NR tuning.

title: bench_oracles: build threaded OpenBLAS/BLIS + verify scaling + hybrid-core pin modes
description: Harden benchmarking so performance claims are unassailable: build OpenBLAS/BLIS from deps with pthreads, add --p-only CPU selection (SMT cores only) + per-pass pinning (single-thread pinned to one CPU), and emit oracle scaling verification (warn if 'threads=N' doesn't increase vs 1).
close_reason: Hardened benchmarking for defensible claims: bench now loads+benches+unloads each oracle sequentially to avoid thread-pool interference; oracle GEMM uses the same 1024^3 size as blazt; bench_oracles.sh adds --p-only hybrid-safe pinning, pins single-thread to one CPU, builds threaded OpenBLAS+BLIS locally, and warns when an oracle doesn't scale.

title: gemm: batch B micro-panels to reduce A repacking (single-thread speed)
description: Improve src/gemm.zig macro-kernel: batch multiple NR panels of B into pack_b so each packed A micro-panel is reused across a wider B block. This reduces redundant A packing work and should significantly improve single-thread GEMM without hidden allocations.
close_reason: Implemented B-panel batching in gemmBlockedRange: pack several NR micro-panels of B and reuse each packed A micro-panel across that block; updated callers/tests to size pack_b via gemm.packBPanelStrideElems/packBPanelCount. Single-thread ops.gemm jumped from ~23 -> ~67 GFLOP/s on 1024^3 bench.

title: bench_oracles: emit markdown summary table

close_reason: Updated tools/bench_oracles.sh to emit a copy/paste markdown snippet: 1 vs max threads table + 'max threads, all libraries' block with p50 GFLOP/s extracted from logs.

title: SVE: prototype scalable-vector kernel strategy

close_reason: Prototyped/documented SVE kernel strategy for Zig 0.16: scalable vectors not expressible with @Vector; recommend runtime VL probe + dispatch to fixed-width kernels (blazt.sve) and scalar tail; documented GEMM implications + future path in docs/sve-prototype.md (linked from DESIGN.md). Debug+ReleaseFast gates pass.

title: ThreadPool: fix intermittent stall / lost tasks
description: Intermittent test hangs in Debug/ReleaseFast traced to ThreadPool losing tasks and/or missed wake during shutdown; repro via repeated ThreadPool tests. Fix should make ThreadPool deterministic and eliminate hangs.
close_reason: Fixed intermittent ThreadPool test stalls/hangs by replacing the lock-free inject/deque scheduling with a simpler mutex+Condition ring-buffer queue; verified via 5000x ThreadPool test loop plus full Debug+ReleaseFast gates.

title: Oracle/bench helper script (run full suite vs OpenBLAS/BLIS/MKL)

title: bench: pin threads / set CPU affinity for reliable measurements

close_reason: Added optional per-worker CPU affinity pinning in ThreadPool (enabled in bench parallel.gemm pools) and updated tools/bench_oracles.sh to taskset-pin the benchmark process and disable dynamic thread behavior (OMP/MKL) for more stable measurements.

title: gemm: port blizz BLIS-style schedule (pack B panel once; parallelize IC blocks)
description: Port BLIS-style GEMM scheduling/tuning ideas from blizz into blazt. Immediate step: remove -Dgemm_tuning presets and derive MR/NR/KC/MC/NC directly from build-time cpu_cache topology (sizes + shared_by). Bench now prints cpu_cache + tile params for verification. Next step: use topology to structure parallelism (shared packed B across tasks; IC-block work distribution).
notes: Done: BLIS-style schedule landed. Tile params now derived directly from build-time cpu_cache topology (no presets). Row-major path uses N-vectorized microkernel + packB once per (jc,pc) and distributes IC blocks across workers, with cache-line aligned packing and heap pack_b when available to avoid repacking. Added memcpy fast paths for contiguous packA(col_major)/packB(row_major). Thread pinning + oracle bench infra exists for verification.
close_reason: Closed

title: SVE: runtime VL probe + dispatch scaffolding
description: Investigate how to obtain SVE vector length at runtime (cntb/cntl) and design a dispatch layer that selects from a small set of fixed-width kernels without regressing non-SVE paths.
close_reason: Added blazt.sve helper module: runtimeVlBytes/runtimeVlElems for aarch64+sve (0 when unavailable) and dispatchFixedVectorLen for selecting among fixed-width kernels; exported via root; added tests (compile-safe on non-SVE) and documented in DESIGN.md. Debug+ReleaseFast gates pass.

title: gemm: microkernel k-unroll + full-tile fast path
description: Close the remaining single-thread GEMM gap by unrolling the microkernel k-loop (4-8x) and adding a full-tile fast path in the macro-kernel so interior blocks hit microKernel (no partial-store overhead).
close_reason: Tried k-unroll/full-tile fast path; net neutral. Big win came from using cache probe the right way: gemmBlockedRange now supports packing the full A block (MC×KC) once when pack_a is large, reusing it across all B panels. ops.gemm and parallel.gemm now allocate a larger pack_a buffer when an allocator is available. P-core-only bench: ops.gemm(f32) ~66 -> ~85 GFLOP/s; parallel.gemm(8 threads) ~450 -> ~498 GFLOP/s.
